summary: DOD contracting officers buy products "off the shelf" to take advantage of innovations and save money. But at times they must navigate a complex process to determine if an item is available commercially and at a fair price. We found that: Required market information on specialized products may be hard to find Contractors may be slow to provide information Additional steps may be needed to...
title: Defense Contracts: Improved Information Sharing Could Help DOD Determine Whether Items Are Commercial and Reasonably Priced
